description.narrative: The engagement facility will provide Accelerator Labs a rapid and flexible response mechanism to deliver activities quickly to support upstream policy results, test innovations or respond to crises

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Activity 1 Indicators 1.1 Number of partners mobilized 1.2 Number of unusual development partners identified 1.3 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level.
Activity 2 Indicators 2.1 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 2.2 Number of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.3 Proportion of solutions scaled/ Solution holders connected to scaling opportunities.
Activity 3 Indicators 3.1 Number of learnings, insights (Knowledge products, blogs, etc.) the Accelerator Lab shares with a public audience 3.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products mainstreamed or taken up by government or other partners 3.3 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programmes mainstreaming lab methods or that are influenced by the Lab's development approach. 3.4 Influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative:
2020 Targets were updated given the start of AccLab Cameroon in October 2020
Activity 1 Targets T1.1 At least 30% of partners in government, private sector and development agencies mobilized per year T 1.2 At least 3 unusual development partners identified and worked with per year. Number of new data sources used at T1.3 At least 2 new data sources mobilized per year to inform Country Office programmes.
Activity 2 Targets T2.1 At least 5 new potential solutions identified per year T2.2 At least 2 innovation methods used per Action Plan T2.3 At least 2 innovations Scaled per year
Activity 3 Targets T3.1 At least 5 blogs, or other substantial knowledge products published per year. T3.2 At least 10% of Lab insights, learnings or processes are mainstreamed in public, private sector work or those of other development partners. T3.3 At least 50% of UNDP CO programmes integrate lab methods in their work per year. T3.4 At least 10% of our learnings challenge National and CO programmes, and provide opportunities for actionable intelligence

Activity 1 Results R1.1 At least 50% of government, private sector and development partners are informed about the Accelerator lab initiative. R1.2 At least 3 new unusual and unknown development actors are brought on board within UNDP to influence traditional development dynamics R1.3 At least 40 % of Country office programmes/units make informed planning decisions based on the new data sources generated by the Accelerator lab.
Activity 2 Results R2.1 A local solutions mapping platform is developed to influence development programming of CO and development partners. R2.2 Insights and Knowledge products are constantly shared on emerging local innovations and innovation methods leveraged on.
Activity 3 Results R3.1 Learnings are generated and accelerated on what works and what doesnt in addressing SDG challenges R3.2 10 % of government, private sector and development partners integrate Accelerator lab methods in their development approach. R3.3 50% of Country Office programmes are influenced by knowledge generated from the Lab
